title: Analyzing Structural Dynamics in Nanocrystalline Thin Films using In-Situ 4D-STEM: A Statistical Approach
content: Traditional in situ transmission electron microscopy (TEM) techniques are highly regarded for their exceptional resolution and the detailed insights into the microstructural dynamics of materials at the nanoscale. However, a significant limitation of these methods is their lack of statistical robustness and representativeness for the materials being studied [1]. In recent years, four-dimensional scanning transmission electron microscopy (4D-STEM) has emerged as a method capable of gathering more comprehensive information across a broader field of view [2] The integration of 4D-STEM with in situ methodologies has made it into a powerful tool for examining material dynamics [3-4]. In this work, we have developed an in situ 4D-STEM technique specifically for the statistical analysis of the structural dynamics in nanocrystalline thin films. The statistical data obtained from in situ 4D-STEM represents a crucial enhancement to traditional in situ TEM methods, providing a more representative understanding of the materials under investigation.
